description: Three improvements to make Exercise Snack more polished and effective: make the notification-style warning in the menu bar dropdown fully readable with clear step-by-step fix instructions, add a chime sound to notifications so they grab the user's attention, and replace the default app icon placeholder with a proper application logo.

userStories.title: Fully Visible Notification Style Warning with Step-by-Step Instructions
userStories.description: As a user, I want the notification-style warning in the menu bar dropdown to display its full text without truncation, with clear step-by-step instructions on how to enable persistent notifications, so I know exactly what to do.
acceptanceCriteria: The warning message is fully visible in the menu bar dropdown â€” no ellipsis or text truncation
The message explains the problem: notifications disappear before the user can act on them (tap "Do it now" / "Snooze")
The message includes numbered step-by-step instructions: 1) Open System Settings, 2) Go to Notifications, 3) Find Exercise Snack, 4) Change notification style from "Banners" to "Alerts"
The layout accommodates the longer text comfortably (e.g. multi-line label, wider popover, or expandable section)
The "Open Notification Settings" button still opens the correct System Settings pane

userStories.title: Notification Chime Sound
userStories.description: As a user, I want exercise notifications to play a pleasant chime sound when they appear, so they grab my attention even if I'm not looking at the screen.
acceptanceCriteria: Notifications play a chime sound when delivered
The chime is a short, pleasant, non-jarring tone appropriate for a wellness app
The sound respects the system Do Not Disturb / Focus mode settings
The sound uses a bundled audio file or a system sound that fits the app's character

userStories.title: Application Logo
userStories.description: As a user, I want Exercise Snack to have a proper app icon instead of the default placeholder, so the app looks polished in the Dock, Finder, and menu bar.
acceptanceCriteria: A custom app icon is designed that reflects the app's purpose (exercise + snack-sized breaks)
The icon is set as the app's icon in the asset catalog (AppIcon in Assets.xcassets)
The icon displays correctly in the Dock, Finder, Spotlight, and About dialog
The icon includes all required sizes for macOS (16x16 through 1024x1024)
The icon follows Apple's macOS icon design guidelines (rounded-rect shape, appropriate detail level)
